007-2001.title: eShop Authentication Error
007-2001.description: This error occurs when opening the eShop on a region changed console. This typically requires a SOAP transfer to resolve.
steps: This error usually indicates your console needs a SOAP transfer.
A SOAP transfer will change your console's region and restore access to region-locked services like the eShop.
Please request a SOAP transfer in #request-soap to resolve this issue. If you are already in a soap channel, please ask a Soaper for help.

009-2001.title: Pokémon Bank Authentication Error
009-2001.description: This error occurs when opening Pokémon Bank on a region changed console. This typically requires a SOAP transfer to resolve.
steps: This error usually indicates your console needs a SOAP transfer.
A SOAP transfer will change your console's region and restore access to region-locked services like Pokémon Bank.
Please request a SOAP transfer in #request-soap to resolve this issue. If you are already in a soap channel, please ask a Soaper for help.

005-5958.title: Pokémon Bank Connection Error
005-5958.description: This error occurs when opening Pokémon Bank on a region changed console. This typically requires a SOAP transfer to resolve.
steps: This error usually indicates your console needs a SOAP transfer.
A SOAP transfer will change your console's region and restore access to region-locked services like Pokémon Bank.
Please request a SOAP transfer in #request-soap to resolve this issue. If you are already in a soap channel, please ask a Soaper for help.

009-1003.title: Pokémon Bank Authentication Error
009-1003.description: This error occurs when opening Pokémon Bank. You have an old Nintendo Network ID from the wrong region on your system.
steps: To resolve, you must remove your old Nintendo Network ID from your system.
**1.** [Make a new NAND backup](<https://3ds.hacks.guide/godmode9-usage.html#creating-a-nand-backup>) and save it somewhere safe.
**2.** Use GodMode9 to [remove your NNID](<https://3ds.hacks.guide/godmode9-usage.html#removing-an-nnid-without-formatting-your-console>) without having to format your console.
After removing the NNID, try opening Pokémon Bank again.

005-5602.title: eShop Connection Error
005-5602.description: This error occurs when opening the eShop on a region changed console. This typically requires a SOAP transfer to resolve.
steps: This error usually indicates your console needs a SOAP transfer.
A SOAP transfer will change your console's region and restore access to region-locked services like the eShop.
Please request a SOAP transfer from a Soaper to resolve this issue.

022-2502.title: Out of Region NNID
022-2502.description: This error occurs when opening the eShop on a SOAP'd console with an out-of-region Nintendo Network ID. You must remove your old Nintendo Network ID from your system.
steps: To resolve, you must remove your old Nintendo Network ID from your system.
**1.** [Make a new NAND backup](<https://3ds.hacks.guide/godmode9-usage.html#creating-a-nand-backup>) and save it somewhere safe.
**2.** Use GodMode9 to [remove your NNID](<https://3ds.hacks.guide/godmode9-usage.html#removing-an-nnid-without-formatting-your-console>) without having to format your console.
After removing the NNID, try opening Pokémon Bank again.

007-2100.title: eShop Download/Connection Error
007-2100.description: This error is often caused by slow download times due to interference or a slow Internet connection.
steps: Check your internet settings and ensure your connection is stable.
Power cycle your router and modem, then try again.
Check for wireless interference and try moving closer to your router.
Enter alternate DNS settings (such as Google DNS: 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4) into your 3DS Internet settings. [Guide](<https://en-americas-support.nintendo.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/217>)
If the issue persists, check [Nintendo's Network Status](<https://support.nintendo.com/networkstatus>) for service maintenance or outages.

022-5515.title: Network Timeout Error)
022-5515.description: This error occurs due to a time-out error when connecting to Nintendo Network services.)
steps: Check for wireless interference and try moving closer to your router.
Turn your router and modem off and on again, then try again.
Enter alternate DNS settings (such as Google DNS: 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4) into your 3DS Internet settings. [Guide](<https://en-americas-support.nintendo.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/217>)
If the issue persists, this may indicate a weak wireless signal or that Nintendo's servers are down.

005-4305.title: eShop Download Error
005-4305.description: This error occurswhen unable to complete a download from the Nintendo eShop. Your Internet connection may have timed out.
steps: Enter alternate DNS settings (such as Google DNS: 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4) into your 3DS Internet settings. [For more information, see Nintendo's support page](<https://en-americas-support.nintendo.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/4346/~/error-code%3A-005-4305>)
Power cycle your router and modem, then try again.
Check for wireless interference and try moving closer to your router.
If the issue persists, this may indicate a weak wireless signal or that Nintendo's servers are down.

005-4040.title: eShop Connection Timeout
005-4040.description: This error occurs after a SOAP transfer when the Nintendo 3DS times out attempting to connect to the eShop.
steps: Power cycle your router and modem, then try again.
Check your network's available bandwidth. If other devices are using bandwidth, your connection may time out.
Enter alternate DNS settings (such as Google DNS: 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4) into your 3DS Internet settings. [Guide](<https://en-americas-support.nintendo.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/217>)
If the issue persists, check for wireless interference and try moving closer to your router.

007-2920.title: eShop Download Failed
007-2920.description: This error occurs after a SOAP transfer when a Nintendo eShop download failed.
steps: Hold the POWER Button down on your system until it powers off, then turn it back on and try again.
Power cycle your home network (router and modem), then try again.
If you have previously changed your system's DNS settings, change this setting back to auto-obtain.

If the system is already set to auto-obtain a DNS, try entering alternate DNS settings (such as Google DNS: 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4). [Guide](<https://en-americas-support.nintendo.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/217>)
If the issue persists, this may indicate a temporary service issue. Please try again later.

007-2670.title: eShop Connection Error - Pretendo (After SOAP)
007-2670.description: This error occurs after a SOAP transfer and is often caused by Pretendo being enabled.
steps: If you're using Pretendo, switch back to Nintendo Network using the Nimbus app.
Open the **Nimbus** app on your 3DS.
Select **Switch to Nintendo Network**.
Your console will reboot.
Try opening the eShop again.

If you're not using Pretendo, this may be a network issue. Check [Nintendo's support page](<https://en-americas-support.nintendo.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/4383/~/error-code%3A-007-2670>) for more troubleshooting steps.

022-5432.title: Network Error - Pretendo Enabled
022-5432.description: This error occurs when Pretendo is turned on and you're trying to access Nintendo services.
steps: Pretendo is currently enabled on your console.
Open the **Nimbus** app on your 3DS.
Select **Switch to Nintendo Network**.
Your console will reboot.
You can now access Nintendo services like the eShop.
To switch back to Pretendo later, use Nimbus again and select **Switch to Pretendo**.

022-5540.title: Network Connection Error
022-5540.description: This error can occur due to server maintenance, poor internet connection, or Pretendo being enabled.
steps: Check [Nintendo's Network Status](<https://support.nintendo.com/networkstatus>) to see if servers are under maintenance.
If you're using Pretendo, switch to Nintendo Network using the Nimbus app:
• Open the **Nimbus** app on your 3DS
• Select **Switch to Nintendo Network**
• Your console will reboot
Check your internet connection and try power cycling your router and modem.
Enter alternate DNS settings (such as Google DNS: 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4) into your 3DS Internet settings. [Guide](<https://en-americas-support.nintendo.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/217>)
If the issue persists, try again later as this may indicate server maintenance.
